cards.title: Rates fall; risk appetite returns
cards.text: Rates fall; risk appetite returns Macro shift → EXPANSION. Inflation 2/5. Credit tightness 1/5. Cash decays 1%/round.

cards.title: Speculation frenzy
cards.text: Speculation frenzy Macro shift → PEAK. Inflation 4/5. Credit tightness 2/5. Cash decays 2%/round; flippers thrive.

cards.title: Liquidity crunch
cards.text: Liquidity crunch Macro shift → CONTRACTION. Inflation 1/5. Credit tightness 4/5. Leveraged deals require +10% extra cash.

cards.title: Recovery bounce
cards.text: Recovery bounce Macro shift → RECOVERY. Inflation 2/5. Credit tightness 2/5. Distressed deals appear; bargains return.

cards.title: You Hesitated. The Deal Is Gone.
cards.text: Fear priced you out. Pay $500. The next Opportunity is revealed — if you pass, any player may take it.

cards.title: Analysis Paralysis Strikes
cards.text: You over-analyzed and lost your window. Pay $1,000 and lose 1 turn. The deal moved on without you.

cards.title: You Waited for Perfect Timing
cards.text: There is no perfect time. Pay $750. The next Opportunity card is revealed — first player to act wins it.

cards.title: You Listened to the Wrong Advisor
cards.text: Your broke uncle talked you out of the investment. Pay $1,500. The deal closes without you.

cards.title: Fear of Debt Paralyzed You
cards.text: You refused to use leverage. Pay $500, lose 1 turn. The next Opportunity is revealed to the table.

cards.title: You Said 'Not Right Now'
cards.text: Right now was the moment. Pay $200. The next Opportunity card is now open to any buyer.

cards.title: Comfort Zone Costs You
cards.text: You stayed comfortable instead of stretching. Pay $2,000 and lose 2 turns. Competitors accelerate.

cards.title: You Wanted More Research
cards.text: The market doesn't wait for you to feel ready. Pay $800. The opportunity is gone.

cards.title: Overthinking Cost You the Deal
cards.text: While you were calculating, someone else was acting. Pay $600 and lose 1 turn.

cards.title: You Trusted a Bad Report
cards.text: A pessimistic analyst's report scared you off. Pay $1,200. The asset gained in value.

cards.title: Committee Killed Your Momentum
cards.text: The deal expired while you were in committee. Pay $1,000 and lose 1 turn.

cards.title: You Got Distracted by Shiny Objects
cards.text: Focus is currency. Pay $400. The next Opportunity card is revealed and open to all.

cards.title: You Said 'I'm Not an Investor'
cards.text: That identity cost you. Pay $3,000. The player who bought is now $3,000 ahead of you.

cards.title: You Didn't Know the Number
cards.text: Financial illiteracy has a price. Pay $500. Learn the ROI formula before your next deal.

cards.title: Imposter Syndrome Won
cards.text: You believed you weren't ready. Pay $750 and lose 1 turn. You were more than ready.

cards.title: You Needed a Sign
cards.text: This IS the sign. Pay $250. The next Opportunity card is revealed — anyone can buy it.

cards.title: You Waited for Prices to Drop
cards.text: Prices rose instead. Pay $2,000. The deal you skipped is now worth 20% more.

cards.title: You Deferred to Someday
cards.text: Someday doesn't come. Pay $1,500 and lose 1 turn. Someday was today.

cards.title: You Prioritized Security Over Growth
cards.text: Security is an illusion. Growth is a choice. Pay $1,000 for choosing neither.

cards.title: Your Ego Killed the Deal
cards.text: You wanted better terms, not better results. Pay $800. The deal goes to the table.

cards.title: You Chased the Wrong Metric
cards.text: You focused on total cost instead of ROI. Pay $1,200. ROI is the only number that matters.

cards.title: Comfort Made You Broke
cards.text: Comfort kills momentum. Pay $500 and lose 2 turns. Discomfort is the price of progress.

cards.title: Real Deals Have Deadlines
cards.text: While you were thinking, the deadline passed. Pay $600. Urgency is not manipulation — it's truth.

cards.title: Comparison Drained Your Clock
cards.text: While you were comparing, they were compounding. Pay $400 and lose 1 turn.

cards.title: You Needed Permission to Win
cards.text: Permission granted: you didn't need anyone's approval. Pay $300. Next Opportunity opens to all.

cards.title: Fear Is a Liar; ROI Is Math
cards.text: Fear is a liar; ROI is math. Pay $1,500. Run the numbers before you run from deals.

cards.title: Saving Preserves Poverty
cards.text: Saving preserves poverty. Investing creates wealth. Pay $700 for the lesson.

cards.title: Critics Aren't Cashflow
cards.text: Critics don't pay your bills. Pay $2,500 and lose 1 turn. Act despite the noise.

cards.title: You Waited for the Market to Recover
cards.text: The market recovered while you waited. Pay $3,000. Missed time never returns.

cards.title: Being Wrong Fast Beats Never Acting
cards.text: Being wrong fast is better than never acting. Pay $900. Next Opportunity card opens to the table.

cards.title: You Outsourced Your Decision
cards.text: Others made the call you should have made. Pay $1,100. Your portfolio, your decisions.

cards.title: Worst-Case Thinking Has a Price
cards.text: Worst-case rarely happens. Best-case requires action. Pay $800 and lose 1 turn.

cards.title: You Watched Instead of Played
cards.text: Perfect deals don't exist. Pay $3,500. Good deals compound; perfect deals expire waiting.
